page.title: 13The Timber Industry
page.content: Mr Michael Watts is a timber merchant who has his business in Dunston. He employs six people and has been in the business since 1950. He owns sixty acres of land but it is impossible to say how many trees there are. He plants 4000 Christmas trees per acre, 1500 deciduous trees per acre, and 2000 poplar trees per acre. The age at which the tree is felled depends upon the type of tree. Christmas trees are felled at between 4 and 7 years old; oaks are not felled until they are 60-100 years old. The average height of a felled tree is 75 feet. 80% of the timber is used for pit props in mines and the other 20% is used for fencing.
